intro: Vahadenia caillei, commonly known as the Caille's vahadenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its small, compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences are notable botanical features. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
